email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s ($50.50 per metric ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit high for us. Could you consider something in the high 40s? Also, can you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your position, but given the current market, the low 50s is quite competitive. However, I can offer $50.25 per metric ton as a gesture of goodwill. Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $50.25 is more acceptable, but can we push the laycan to 18-23 October? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s availability for this window? Appreciate your flexibility. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve checked with the vessel owner, and the MV Ocean Star is available for the revised laycan of 18-23 October. Let’s proceed with $50.25 per metric ton, 72 hours laytime, and demurrage at $25,000 per day. If this works, I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that sounds good. Please go ahead with the charter party agreement. Let’s finalize the details and get this shipment moving. Thanks for your help! Cheers, John
